CulturalObject.Description: Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT733. 1. Announcement: ... March 24th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3-4. Solo male speech, probably in the Loko language. 5. Ref tone. 6. Solo male speech. Reasonable quality recording but with surface noise. C51/3182 and C51/769 (better quality) are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT644 (444m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 644, Timne, Kamalu, May 19th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/2689 is the master, C51/3009 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT675 (675d on cylinder rim; 2 balan on box). 1. Announcement: Record 675, er, Kabal [?] September 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Duet for balangi, a type of xylophone, played by Susu, Malinke, Yalunka, Koranko and Temne musicians. Good quality recording. C51/2976 (better quality) and C51/3068 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT630 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Timne record, [indecipherable] April 16th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group. Good quality recording. C51/2979 (better quality) is the master, C51/2980 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT631 (635 [sic] NWT on rim; Mendi [male sign] on lid). 1. Announcement: Record 631, Mende, [indecipherable] April 16th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3-4. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Good quality recording. C51/2981 and C51/2982 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT632 ([male sign] L [female sign] on lid). 1. Ref tone. 2. Announcement: Record 632, Laminaia, May 1st 1914. Susu. 3. Female vocal group with male leader. Good quality recording. C51/2983 (better quality) and C51/2984 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT633 (m on cylinder rim; Susu on lid). 1. Announcement: Record 633, Susu, Laminaia, Many 1st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with male leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/2985 (better quality) is the master, C51/2986 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

NWT634 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 634, Susu, Laminaia, May 1st 1914. 2. Ref tone 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with male leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/2987 (better quality) is the master, C51/2988 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT635 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 635, Susu, Laminaia, May 1st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with male leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/2989 (better quality) is the master, C51/2991 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT636 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 636, Susu Somaia. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/2992 (better quality) is the master, C51/2993 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT637 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Mandingo. Record 637. Somaia. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. Good quality recording. C51/2994 (better quality) is the master, C51/2995 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT638 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 638, Susu, Somaia, May 7th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. Good quality recording. C51/2996 is the master, C51/2997 (better quality) is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT639 (m on cylinder rim; [male sign] on lid). 1. Announcement: Record 639. 2. Ref tone. 3. Timne, Kamalu, May 19th 1914. 4. Male vocal group with leader, acc. percussion. Tracks 1-3 poor quality; track 4 is a good quality recording. C51/2998 (better quality) is the master, C51/2999 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT640 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 640. Timne, Kamalu, May 18th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal group with leader, accompanied by percussion. Good quality recording. C51/3000 (better quality) is the master, C51/3001 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT641 (m on cylinder rim; [male sign] L [female sign] on lid). 1. Announcement: Record 6...1, Timne, Kamalu, May 19th 1914. 2. Ref. tone. 3. Female vocal group with male leader, accompanied by percussion. Good quality recording. C51/3002 (better quality) is the master, C51/3003 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT642 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 642. Timne, Kamalu, May 19th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Female vocal group with male leader, accompanied by percussion. Reasonable quality recording but with surface noise and weak signal. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT676 (m on cylinder rim; Balan on box). 1. Announcement: Record 676, Kabala [?] September 22nd 1914. Balan [?]. 2. Ref tone. 3. Duet for balangi - a xylophone type instrument. Good quality recording but with variable signal. C51/3006 (better quality) is the master, C51/3069 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT643 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 643, Timne, Kamalu, May 19th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal group with leader, accompanied by percussion. Good quality recording but cylinder cracked at start. C51/3007 (better quality) is the master, C51/3008 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT645. 1. Announcement: Record 644 [sic] Sendugu, June 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording but cylinder cracked. C51/3010 and C51/3011 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT646 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 646, Sendugu, June 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3012 (better quality) is the master, C51/3013 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT647 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 647. Sendugu, June 2[?]th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3014 (better quality) is the master, C51/3015 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT648 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 648. Sendugu, June 26th 1914. Fula. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female [?] vocal solo with leader. NB Krio Fula is a dialect of Fuuta Jalon. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3016 (better quality) is the master, C51/3017 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT649 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 649, Fula, June 26th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. NB: Krio Fula is a dialect of Fuuta Jalon. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3018 (better quality) is the master, C51/3019 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT650 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 650, Fula, Sendugu, June 26th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal solo. NB: Krio Fula is a dialect of Fuuta Jalon. Good quality recording. C51/3020 (better quality) is the master, C51/3021 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT651 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: 651. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal solo (continuation of NWT650, therefore language is Krio Fula, a dialect of Fuuta Jalon). 4. Solo male speech. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3022 (better quality) is the master, C5/3023 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT652 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 652, Timne story, July 1st 1914. 2. Solo male speech and song. Reasonable quality recording but with weak signal. C51/3024 (better quality) is the master, C51/3025 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT653 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 653. Timne. July 1st 1914. 2. Male conversation. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3026 (better quality) is the master, C51/3027 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT654 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 654, Timne, July 1st 1914. 2. Male conversation. Reasonable quality recording but with surface noise. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT655 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 655, Timne, July 1st 1914. 2. Male conversation. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3029 (better quality) is the master, C51/3030 and C51/3031 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT656 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 656, Sendugu, July 2nd 1914. Kundi [?], one string guitar. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo bowed chordophone. 4. Rewound. 5. As track 3. NB: A kundi is a harp from the Azande of the northern Democratic of the Congo. A kondi is a lamellophone from Sierra Leone. Neither of these instruments would appear to be that played in this recording. Reasonable quality recording but weak signal. C51/3032 (better quality) is the master, C51/3033 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT657; Frazer No.583 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 657, July 3rd 1914, [indecipherable], Timne. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied vocal solo. Poor quality recording with weak signal throughout. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

CulturalObject.Object: NWT658: Male vocal solo and chordophone
CulturalObject.Description: Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT658 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 658, [indecipherable], July 3rd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo, accompanied by bowed chordophone. Reasonable quality recording but cylinder cracked and bandaged at start. C51/3035 is the master, C51/3036 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT659 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 659 [indecipherable], July 3rd, 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo, accompanied by bowed chordophone. Reasonable quality recording but with variable signal strength. C51/3037 (better quality is the master, C51/3038 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT660. 1. Announcement: Record 660, Matotaka, July 30th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo accompanied by childrens (or female) chorus. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3039 and C51/3040 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT661 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 661, Matotaka, July 30th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo accompanied by female vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3041 is the master, C51/3042 (better quality) is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT662 ([male and female signs] on box). 1. Announcement: Record 662, Matotaka, July 30th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo, accompanied by female vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

CulturalObject.Object: NWT663: Male vocal solo with female chorus
CulturalObject.Description: Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT663 ([male and female signs] on box; m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 663, Matotaka [?], July 30th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo accompanied by female vocal group. Good quality recording. C51/3044 (better quality) is the master, C51/3045 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

CulturalObject.Object: NWT664: Male vocal solo with female vocal group
CulturalObject.Description: Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT664 ([male and female signs] on box; m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 6...4, Matotaka, July 30th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal solo accompanied by female vocal group. Good quality recording. C51/3046 (better quality) is the master, C51/3047 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT665 ([male sign] and Kumpa macir on box). 1. Announcement: Record 665. Mayasa [or Mayaka?] July 10th 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3048 (better quality) and C51/3085 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT666 ([male sign] on box; m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 666, Mayaso, July 10th 1914. Kumpamacir. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group. Good quality recording. C51/3050 (better quality) is the master, C51/3051 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT667. 1. Announcement: Record 6...7, [indecipherable], August 31st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3052 (better quality) and C51/3053 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT668 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 668, [indecipherable] August 31st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3054 (better quality) is the master, C51/3055 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT669 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: ...9, Limba, [indecipherable], August 31st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording but with variable signal. NB: It is not clear whether the language is East Limba or West Central Limba. C51/3056 is the master, C51/3057 (better quality) is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT670 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 670 [indecipherable], September 1st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal solo. 4. Solo male speech. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3058 is the master, C51/3059 (better quality) and C51/766 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT671 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 671, Odumba[?], September 3rd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3060 (better quality) and C51/3061 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT672 (Limba on box). 1. Announcement: Record 672, Odumba [?], September 3rd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. NB It is not clear whether the language is East Limba or West Central Limba. Reasonable quality recording but cylinder cracked and glued. C51/3062 is probably the master, C51/3063 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT673 ([female sign] on box; m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 673, Odumba[?], September 3rd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. Good quality recording. C51/3064 (better quality) is the master, C51/3065 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT674 ([female sign] on box). 1. Announcement: Record 674, Odumba[?] September 3rd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3066 (better quality) is probably the master, C51/3067 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT678 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 678, Kabala, September 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group, probably in Maninka, Kankan language. Good quality recording. C51/3071 (better quality) is the master, C51/3072 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT679 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 679, Kabala, September 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group with leader, probably in the Malinka, Kankan language. C51/3073 (better quality) is the master, C51/3074 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT680. 1. Announcement: Record 680, Kabala[?], September 22nd 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT680 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 681, Mabonto. Flute, October 21st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied flute solo. Good quality recording. C51/3076 (better quality) is the master, C51/3077 is a duplicate. NWT681: announced as 681on the recording. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT682 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 682, Mabonto, flute. October 21st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied flute solo. Good quality recording. C51/3078 (better quality) is the master, C51/3079 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT683 (m on cylinder rim; Koranko and [male sign] on box). 1. Announcement: Record number 683, song[?] Mabonto October 21st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male vocal group with leader, unaccompanied. Good quality recording. C51/3080 (better quality) is the master, C51/3081 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT684 (m on cylinder rim; [male sign] and cracked on box). 1. Announcement: Record 684, Mabonto, October 21st 1914. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording but cylinder cracked. C51/3082 is the master, C51/3083 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT685 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 684, [indecipherable] song, December 8th 1914. [indecipherable]. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group. Reasonable quality recording. C51/3084 (better quality) is the master, C51/3049 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT689 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT690 (?m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 690, Mende story, Kenema, January 205th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Male speech. 4. Same story, repeated 5. Male speech. Reasonable quality recording but with weak signal and surface noise. C51/3094 is the master, C51/3095 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT691 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 691, Mende story, Kenema, January 20th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech. 4. 691a, repeated. 5. Solo male speech. Good quality recording but the ediphones recording mechanism is audible. C51/3096 (better quality) is the master, C51/3097 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT692 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 690, repeated. 2. Ref tone. 3-4. Solo male speech. Reasonable quality recording but with weak signal and surface noise. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT695 (?m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 695, Mende song, Kenema January 21st 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied male vocal solo. Good quality recording with strong signal resulting in some loud peaks. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT706 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 706, Mende song, Kenema, January 26th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccomapnied vocal group with leader. Good quality recording. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT707 (m on cylinder rim; Mendi Porro on box). 1. Announcement: Record 707, Mende Poro song, Kenema, January 26th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Antiphonal song sung by vocal group with leader. According to Thomas, Poro is a secret society of the Timne, Mende and Bulem tribes (Thomas, Report. Timne-Speaking Peoples Pt.1 (London. Harrison and Sons, 1915) p.143). Good quality recording. C51/3128 (better quality) is the master, C51/3129 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT708 (m on cylinder rim; Mendi Porro on box). 1. Announcement: Record 708, January 26th 1915. Mende song. 2. Ref tone. 3. Antiphonal song sung by vocal group with leader. According to Thomas, Poro is a secret society of the Timne, Mende and Bulem tribes (Thomas, Report. Timne-Speaking Peoples Pt.1 (London. Harrison and Sons, 1915) p.143). Good quality recording but with a strong signal resulting in distortion at times. C51/3130 (better quality) is the master, C51/3131 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT709 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 709. Mende song, January 26th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Antiphonal song sung by vocal group with leader. Reasonable quality recording but with distortion. C51/3132 (better quality) is the master, C51/3133 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT710 (m on cylinder rim; [female sign] on box). 1. Announcement: Record number 710, Mende song, Pujehun, February 13th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied female vocal group singing in harmony. Good quality recording. C51/3134 (better quality) is the master, C51/3135 is a duplicate. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT727 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT728 (?m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record number 728, Sherbro story, March 23rd 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech. 4. My name is Ibrahaim Abamzura, and I am a Sherbro. Good quality recording. C51/3169 (better quality) is the master, C51/3170 and C51/767 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.
CulturalObject.AssociatedPeople: Thomas, Northcote Whitridge (1868-1936) [Sound Recordist]; Abamzura, Ibrahaim [Performer]

CulturalObject.Description: Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT729 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 729, Timne, March 23rd, 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Loko record. 4. Solo male speech. Reasonable quality recording but with surface noise and weak signal. C51/3171 is the master, C51/3172 (better quality) and C51/3173 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT730 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record number 730, Mende story, March 23rd 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech in the Mende language. Good quality recording. C51/3174 (better quality) is the master, C51/3175 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT731 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record 731. 730. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech, probably in the Mende language. Good quality recording. C51/3176 (better quality) is the master, C51/3177 and C51/768 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT732 (?m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Mende story, Ma ... er ... Record number 732, March 23rd 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech. 4. Solo childs speech. Reasonable quality recording but cylinder cracked at start. C51/3178 (better quality) is the master, C51/3179, C51/3180 and C51/3181 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT739 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: ... 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Solo male speech, probably in the Temne language. Poor quality recording due to cylinder being cracked and bandaged. C51/3201 is the master, C51/3202, C51/3203 and C51/3204 are duplicates. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT740 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT741 (d on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: ...41, Timne Orphan [?] song, March 24th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied vocal group. 4. Ref tone. 5-6. Unaccompanied male vocal solo. Reasonable quality recording but with surface noise due to master cylinder being cracked and distortion in track 5. C51/3207 is the master, C51/3208 (better quality) is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.

Historical wax cylinder recording made by Northcote Whitridge Thomas, a British government anthropologist who conducted field research in Sierra Leone in 1914-15. NWT742 (m on cylinder rim). 1. Announcement: Record number 742, March 26th 1915. 2. Ref tone. 3. Unaccompanied vocal group with leader, probably in the Temne language. 4. Unaccompanied male vocal solo. Good quality recording. C51/3209 (better quality) is the master, C51/3156 is a duplicate. This is a digital access version of an original wax cylinder recording held in the collection of the British Library. Supplied and used with permission from The British Library.
